recommendations: Akanksha . “Vikas was a fantastic person to work with, and is not only a multi-skilled and insightful colleague, but also an inspiring strategist. Very good person. Great employee with a very strong problem solving skills.It is an honor for me to recommend him.”

Lalit Chattar “Vikas is a dedicated, experienced, software professional with a vast experience in all aspects of software engineering. He is also an excellent team player, with high integrity and work ethics. Vikas can make great contributions to a company and help build excellent products. He is fun to work with!”
projects: [{"title":"WeLottify: Decentralized Powerball game using crypto-currency.","start_date":"Jun 2017","description":"We participated in a global hackathon organized by the Status.im team. A GitHub issue was opened as an idea and later a pull request (PR) was submitted as a successful completion of the project.Full description of the project here: https://github.com/status-im/hackathon/issues/40"},{},{"title":"Dead Men Block : It's decentralized fail-safe trigger(aka dead men switch)","start_date":"Feb 2017","description":"Today, more and more people live online lives that leaves a digital trail that is difficult to clean up if they were to suddenly die. Services like Gmail and Facebook makes it hard, if not impossible, to gain access after a person's death. This is just one of the many reasons why we should have a plan to help loved ones deal with our unexpected tragic events.fun fact: both Julian Assange (wikileaks) and Edward Snowden have a dead man switch to release secret documents in case something happens to them.Read more on the project URL. We were the grand prize winner.Tom handles the UI/UX and I develop the background solidity code for ethereum blockchain"},{},{"title":"Selective sharing of medical records with On-chain Permission for \"Blockchain Virtual UAE GovHack\"​","start_date":"Dec 2016","description":"We submitted the project on the idea of making \"sharing of medical records easier and secure\" for Blockchain Virtual UAE GovHack. It involved selective sharing of medical records. in short, making the patient owner of his medical records.Patient can set the permission for only the details s/he want to share with the doctor to view. He can anytime revoke the access provided to the Doctor. This helps patients to stay in control of the detail they want to share.Doctor can upload the documents as well for the patient, in consideration, while providing the services.We used Ethereum Blockchain for it.Technologies UsedResponsive Design Ethereum css solidity php javascript html IPFS web3js MetaMask infura.io Code repository:https://github.com/vikas1188/Gov-Hack/tree/master"},{},{"title":"POC on BLOCKCHAIN: Property transfer Use case","start_date":"May 2016","description":"Blockchain has it's presence since the days of BitCoin, but it take sometime to recognize the hidden potential of the backbone of this technology, Blockchain. This technology is changing the face of P2P lending in finance across the globe. Some Banks in Russia, VISA has started investing highly in the Blockchain R&D.Though its application are not just limited to just the financial domain. It can be applied to store the transaction details for anything of value. In my case, 'transfer of property'.We used the Ethereum's MIX IDE to develop the use case. We simulated the environment in which we can allocate the property( a string name for ease of understanding) and then transfer it to the registered user. This user then can transfer it to some other valid owner.We take care of the double spending in our 'smart contract'. We also make sure that any property which is not present in the Blockchain should not be allowed to be transferred to any person.This is one such cut throat technology, on which huge banking applications are being built or planning to build."},{},{"title":"Alternate of 3-D PIN: Pattern as a TXN password in financial system","start_date":"Jan 2016","description":"In today's financial system, most of the TXNs are authenticated via OTP. It is used for passing the 'something you have' barrier of 2FA. Though, OTP is still unreliable and error-prone to business & huge dependency on Network(congestion).What we tried here in this project is to create something equally complex of an OTP( restricted only for digits, not alphanumeric), yet easy to remember transaction password, based upon the patterns and wished to replace the it.As lots of Application are now omitting the OTP and applying algorithm to generate a token in the backend while the transaction taking place to authorize the 'something you have' in 2FA.We want to provide this tool to the security agencies which provide 3-D PIN. They provide it, but seldom used by consumers and have larger acceptance. One main reason for not using the 3-D PIN is also that they are random 6 numeric digits and are hard to remember. So thats two loopholes in 3-D PIN.That's why peopl generate the OTP and seldom care for 5-10 seconds that they wait. but if that's converted into the amount of time an avg people wait, just to receive an OTP, in an year, it can easily come to 2-4 Hours. depending upon the no of TXNs he makes.So, What we tried is to provide the complexity of OTP and ease of remembrance within one single alternative & thats 'patterns'. People use and create patterns for remembering things for longer period. This project was converted into a successful demonstration to the jury as well."},{},{},{"title":"Generating a trigger on winking of the eye using front Camera in Android devices","start_date":"Jan 2013","description":"The Idea was to flip pages of pdf, turning to next/previous song, volume up/down by the wink of eye & many more fun-things.We successfully demo-ed this idea. We were able to generate the trigger on the wink of the eye."},{},{},{},{"title":"Google Maps over SMS","start_date":"Jan 2012","description":"we created an application that provides you the step-by-step path from SOURCE to DESTINATION in the text format over your phone in SMS.It provides the location and route from point A to point B for NON-data users or low level mobile phone.You get a simple SMS(es) once you send the SMS having point A and point B."},{},{}]
